fr.upmc.components.ComponentI.ComponentService

  • Packages that use ComponentI.ComponentService 
    Package Description
    fr.upmc.components
    Basic component model.

    • Uses of ComponentI.ComponentService in fr.upmc.components

      Methods in fr.upmc.components with parameters of type ComponentI.ComponentService 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> AbstractComponent.handleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> task) 
      <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> ComponentI.handleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
      execute a request represented by a Callable on the component.
      void AbstractComponent.handleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<?> task) 
      void ComponentI.handleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<?> request)
      execute a request represented by a Callable on the component, but asynchronously, i.e. without waiting for the result but returning the control immediately to the caller.
      <T> T AbstractComponent.handleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> task) 
      <T> T ComponentI.handleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request)
      execute a request represented by a Callable on the component, but synchronously, i.e. waiting for the result and returning it to the caller.
      <T> java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<T> AbstractComponent.scheduleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u) 
      <T> java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<T> ComponentI.scheduleRequest(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a service for execution after a given delay.
      void AbstractComponent.scheduleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<?> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u) 
      void ComponentI.scheduleRequestAsync(ComponentI.ComponentService<?> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a service for execution after a given delay, without making the caller wait of giving it a possibility to synchronise with the result.
      <T> T AbstractComponent.scheduleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      FIXME: does not make sense in the remote call case!
      <T> T ComponentI.scheduleRequestSync(ComponentI.ComponentService<T> request, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit u)
      schedule a service for execution after a given delay, forcing the caller to wait for the result.
